key_mistakes.reason: This move allows White to gain a significant advantage by developing pieces actively and challenging Black's center.
This move places the queen awkwardly and allows Black to gain tempo with a potential attack on the queen.
This move results in a loss of material after Black's fxe5, which was not played.
This move places the rook in a vulnerable position, allowing White to easily capture it without compensation.

recommendations: Focus on developing pieces to active squares quickly.
Avoid placing pieces on squares where they can be easily attacked.
Maintain control of the center to restrict opponent's piece activity.
Ensure the king's safety through solid pawn structures and timely castling.
